## setInManyUnsafe() function

Similar to [setInUnsafe](./paths.setinunsafe.md)<!-- -->, but takes any number of path-value pairs as args and applies them in sequence by calling `setIn()` for each.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function setInManyUnsafe<T>(state: T, p1: Path, v1: any): T;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  state | <code>T</code> |  |
|  p1 | <code>Path</code> |  |
|  v1 | <code>any</code> |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

`T`

## Remarks

Any intermediate key paths missing in the data structure will be created. Does NOT mutate original (instead use  for this purpose).

The type parameter `T` can be used to indicate the type of the overall state value and will also be used as return type.

## Example


```ts
setInManyUnsafe(
  {},
  // pair #1
  "a.b", 10,
  // pair #2
  "x.y.z", 20
);
// { a: { b: 10 }, x: { y: { z: 20 } } }

```
